text: [Music]
there's this term in the poker world
called poker broke where you're still
living okay there's still someone who's
loaned you money or is Bank rolling you
and you're still playing in big games
but that only happens if you have the
reputation that goes along with that
bankroll that you're willing to risk so
there's certainly a downside to going
broke but you're not out of the game
it's not like you stop playing poker and
you go find a job you know somewhere
else um so I mean certainly I you know
you need to protect your reputation and
you need to make sure that people at
least still respect your game or you
know or else you really do have to play
in such a way um as to make sure that
you're ruin factor is s of zero um there
are a couple I think important uh things
about poker you know skills that you
learn at the poker table that are very
useful in business um you know one thing
that poker trains you to do is I mean
really the definition of Poker is trying
to make good
decisions um you know under conditions
of uncertainty and and certainly in in
business that comes up all the time
you're you're weighing the chances of
certain things happening and you're
trying to maximize your results and sort
of account for certain things like
recessions or you know a downturn in
your Market or too much competition um
um uh you you constantly have to
allocate resources um whether they be
you know Manpower or money toward
certain things that you just can't know
the future um you know I think another
thing and and and possibly the most
important thing I think that you bring
from the poker table to the business
world is I think a strong sense of sort
of empathy uh to be a successful poker
player you really have to put yourself
in the position or in the head of your
opponent and I I think where that really
comes into play is at the negotiating
table so you have to give the person
you're negotiating with um sort of
respect um but at the same time you're
trying to probe their weaknesses figure
out exactly you know how strong their
hand is how desperate are they to sell
whatever it is whatever whether it's a
service or or a product to you um and
you know really try and negotiate them
down to that price that's not so good
for you that it ends up being a bad
relationship and you and you know but
you certainly don't want to overpay
either and I think the only way that you
actually can um consistently you know
negotiation after negotiation after
negotiation and if you're in business
you're just constantly negotiating with
different people you're always trying to
find that right place where you're not
overpaying you're giving them the deal
they need and the only way you can do
that is by thinking about their needs
and what they're bringing to the table
as well as your own you can't just be
sort of negotiating in a one-sided way
